de.feig.FEDM.Core

Class IKeyMngGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.feig.FEDM.Core.IKeyMngGroup

  • public class IKeyMngGroup
extends java.lang.Object
    Internal class providing methods for key-managment.
    Description
    This class realizes the nested interface with methods for key managment for the Reader class ReaderModule.
    Methods of this class can be called with the IKeyMng member of ReaderModule.

    • Method Detail

      • writeTagAuthentKey_Mifare

        public int writeTagAuthentKey_Mifare(int keyType,
                                     int keyAddress,
                                     java.lang.String key)
                              throws FeException
        Transfer and persistent store of an Authentication Key for ISO 14443 MIFARE Transponder
        (MIFARE classic, MIFARE mini and MIFARE 1K or 4K) with [0xA2] Write MIFARE Reader Keys command.
        Parameters:
        keyType - For Key-Type A = 0 and for Key-Type B = 1
        keyAddress - Address where the key is stored in the reader. Applicable values are 0..7.
        key - Key for authentication
        Returns:
        operation status
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)
        Description:
        A key which is used by the Reader for authentication to an NXP MIFARE Transponder will be stored persistent in the Reader.
        Only if the key of the Reader and of the Transponder correspond, the data exchange between Reader and Transponder can be successful executed.
        The factory adjustment of the keys on KEY-ADR 0x00 is:
        - KEY-A: 0xFFFFFFFFFFFF
        - KEY-B: 0xFFFFFFFFFFFF
        Method returns:
        0: OK
        >0: status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

      • writeTagAuthentKey_ISO14443

        public int writeTagAuthentKey_ISO14443(boolean eeprom,
                                       int index,
                                       int authentMode,
                                       java.lang.String key)
                                throws FeException
        Transfer and store a DES or AES Authentication Key for ISO 14443 Transponder
        (MIFARE DESFire, MIFARE Plus and MIFARE Ultralight C) with [0xA3] Write DES/AES Reader Keys command.
        Parameters:
        eeprom - if false, the key is stored temporarely in the RAM. if true, the key is stored in the EEPROM.
        index - Address where the key is stored in the reader.
        authentMode - Type of key
        - 0: DESFire Native - TDES (16 byte) applicable for MIFARE DESFire
        - 1: Standard TDES (16 byte) applicable for MIFARE DESFire and MIFARE Ultralight C
        - 2: DESFire Native - DES (8 byte) applicable for MIFARE DESFire
        - 3: Standard DES (8 byte) applicable for MIFARE DESFire
        - 4: 3KTDES (24 byte) applicable for MIFARE DESFire
        - 5: AES (16 byte) applicable for MIFARE DESFire and MIFARE Plus
        key - Key for authentication
        Returns:
        operation status
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)
        Description:
        An AES or DES key which is used by the Reader for authentication to an NXP MIFARE Transponder will be stored in the Reader.
        Only if the key of the Reader and of the Transponder correspond, the data exchange between Reader and Transponder can be successful executed.
        Method returns:
        0: OK
        >0: status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

      • writeTagAuthentKey_UcodeDNA

        public int writeTagAuthentKey_UcodeDNA(boolean eeprom,
                                       int index,
                                       java.lang.String key)
                                throws FeException
        Transfer and store an AES Authentication Key for NXP UCODE/ICODE DNA Transponder with [0xA3] Write AES Reader Keys command.
        Parameters:
        eeprom - if false, the key is stored temporarely in the RAM. if true, the key is stored in the EEPROM.
        index - Address where the key is stored in the reader.
        key - AES-Key for authentication
        Returns:
        operation status
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)
        Description:
        An AES key which is used by the Reader for authentication to an NXP UCODE/ICODE DNA Transponder will be stored in the Reader.
        Only if the key of the Reader and of the Transponder correspond, the data exchange between Reader and Transponder can be successful executed.
        Method returns:
        0: OK
        >0: status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

      • writeTagAuthentKey_EPC

        public int writeTagAuthentKey_EPC(boolean eeprom,
                                  int keyType,
                                  java.lang.String key)
                           throws FeException
        Transfer and store an Authentication Key for EPC Transponder with [0xAD] Write Reader Authentication Key command.
        Parameters:
        eeprom - if false, the key is stored temporarely in the RAM. if true, the key is stored in the EEPROM.
        keyType - Only the value 3 is applicable for EPC Transponders
        key - Key for authentication
        Returns:
        operation status
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)
        Description:
        A key which is used by the Reader for authentication to a EPC Transponder will be stored in the Reader.
        Only if the key of the Reader and of the Transponder correspond, the data exchange between Reader and Transponder can be successful executed.
        Method returns:
        0: OK
        >0: status byte of the responded protocol, if the Reader signals a problem. See Reader's System Manual for the full list with all status bytes
        This method can throw a de.feig.FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.
